turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking for some game recommendations. I'm really in the mood for something in the strategy genre, but I'm kind of tired of the usual real-time stuff. Anything a bit different?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I understand. You're looking for strategy games, but want to avoid real-time strategy. I can help with that. Have you considered turn-based strategy games? Some popular titles include the *Civilization* series, *XCOM 2*, or *Into the Breach*. Would any of those be of interest?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yeah, I've played Civ and XCOM. Into the Breach sounds interesting, I'll check that out. But what I *really* want is something with a good story. Something gripping, you know? Do any of those strategy games have particularly compelling narratives, or am I barking up the wrong tree here looking for story in a strategy game? I'm getting frustrated trying to find something...

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration! It can be tough to find that perfect blend. While *Into the Breach* is more gameplay-focused, *Crusader Kings III* is known for generating emergent narratives based on the actions of your characters and the complex web of relationships between them. You essentially write your own epic story. Alternatively, *The Banner Saga* is a turn-based strategy game with a beautifully crafted, albeit grim, narrative and stunning visuals. I hope one of these is what you are looking for!
